children.subject: (Not sure if this is 100% accurate, this is really a good question for your advisor) Neuroscience is through MCB so unless you want to do breadths for both CoE and L&S it might be worth looking into switching into L&S CS. I have heard of people double majoring across colleges though but it seems like a lot of work.

Because it's separate colleges, you'd have to fill out a simultaneous degree petition, which basically has you list out the courses you're planning to take and submit it to advisors from both colleges to confirm that you could suitably handle the courseload.

In contradiction to Anon Gear above, it's not that difficult to simultaneous degree vs. double major within a college, because your H/SS requirements should be covered entirely by L&S breadths. You'd still "benefit" from switching into L&S CS because you wouldn't have to take the Ethics, Physics, and Multivariable requirements (among maybe some other ones), but that's just EECS v.s. L&S CS

history.content: Could anyone give any advice on how I would go about doing a double major in EECS + Neuroscience? Currently a rising EECS Sophomore (class of 2024)
history.subject: Double major EECS+Neuroscience?
